alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:23PM CDT until March 28 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... James River at Galena affecting Stone County. Spring River at Carthage affecting Jasper County. Elk River near Tiff City affecting McDonald County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Galena. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Flood waters reach the floor of the 413 bridge over Railey Creek near the confluence with the James River south of the gage site. (946 FT MSL) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Friday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.9 feet on 04/15/1945. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
